tool.name: OSP candidates
tool.description: constructs a putative list of potential o-spanin from an input genomic FASTA

param.label: Range Selection; default is all; for a specific range to check for a spanin input integers separated by a colon (eg. 1234:4321)
param.name: switch

param.label: Lipobox minimal distance from start codon
param.name: osp_min_dist

param.label: Lipobox maximum distance from start codon
param.name: osp_max_dist
param.help: Searches for a Lipobox between Lipoboxmin and Lipoboxmax ie [Lipoboxmin,Lipoboxmax]

param.label: Minimum amount of residues after lipobox is found
param.name: lipo_min

param.label: Maximum amount of residues after lipobox is found
param.name: lipo_max

tool.help:
**What it does** Searches a genome for candidate o-spanins (OSPs), a phage protein involved in outer membrane disruption during Gram-negative bacterial host cell lysis.
**METHODOLOGY**
Locates ALL potential start sequences, based on TTG / ATG / GTG (M / L / V). This generates a set of files with all ORFs in FASTA (nt and aa), BED, and GFF3 file formats.
For each sequence in the protein FASTA, the tool then checks within the user-specified range:
1. Min distance from start codon to lipobox start residue 2. Max distance from start codon to lipobox start residue 3. Min number of periplasmic residues after a 4-residue lipobox 4. Max number of periplasmic residues after a 4-residue lipobox
using a regular expression (RegEx) to identify a potential lipobox. The following residues are allowed for the potential lipobox:
* [ILMFTV][^REKD][GAS]C * AW[AGS]C
**INPUT** --> Genomic FASTA *NOTE: This tool only takes a SINGLE genomic fasta. It does not work with multiFASTAs.*
**OUTPUT** --> putative_osp.fa (FASTA) file, putative_osp.gff3, and basic summary statistics file as sumamry_osp.txt Protein sequences which passed the above filters are returned as the candidate OSPs.
